description: Start with decimal expansion of n; if all digits have the same parity, stop; otherwise write down the number formed by the even digits and the number formed by the odd digits and add them; repeat.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := (id = IntegerDigits[n]; oddDigits = Select[id, OddQ]; evenDigits = Select[id, EvenQ]; Which[ oddDigits == {}, FromDigits[ evenDigits ], evenDigits == {}, FromDigits[ oddDigits ], True, FromDigits[ evenDigits ] + FromDigits[ oddDigits ]]); a[n_] := FixedPoint[f, n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 75}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, May 31 2013 *)
